more_info.origin: Synthetic compound, produced from ethylene oxide (a synthetic compound) and stearic acid (a natural fatty acid).
more_info.daily_intake: Up to 25 mg/kg body weight for the entire group of compounds in the 430-E436 range; on the other hand, it has not been specified for the individual compounds.
more_info.side_effects: None known in the concentrations used. People intolerant of propylene glycol should also avoid the group of 430-E436.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: These compounds (430-E436) contain fatty acids, which are nearly always from vegetable oils; however, use of animal fat (including pork) cannot be fully ruled out. Chemically, the origin of these compounds cannot be determined; only the producer may provide information on the origin.
